Title: French I
Description: Introductory French. Includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: French II
Description: ContinuesFREN 101. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: French III
Description: ContinuesFREN 102. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: French IV
Description: Intermediate French. Includes grammar review, listening, speaking, and reading, with individual audiolingual practice. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: French V
Description: ContinuesFREN 201. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Advanced Writing and Speaking
Description: French 310 provides advanced practice in written and oral communication, including journalistic, professional, and creative writing. Examines contemporary cultural contexts through media and news. Taught in French.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Introduction to Language for the Professions
Description: This course provides an introduction to communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in French.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Introduction to Identities and Communities
Description: This course provides an introduction to the analysis of individual and collective identities, including issues of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, class, nationality, and religion. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in French.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Introduction to Power and Resistance
Description: This course provides an introduction to the analysis of power relations and issues of (in)equality rooted in contemporary political and socio-economic systems. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in French.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Introduction to Language, Media, and Society
Description: This course provides an introduction to the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in French.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Advanced Grammar and Translation
Description: This course provides advanced grammar instruction and fosters translation and communication skills within a contemporary cultural context. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in French.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Advanced Studies in Language for the Professions

Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits
